verses.roman:
alabdha-maṇir āgatya
kṛṣṇa āhāgrajāntikam
vṛthā hataḥ śatadhanur
maṇis tatra na vidyate

synonyms: alabdha—not finding; maṇiḥ—the gem; āgatya—approaching; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; āha—said; agra-ja—of His elder brother; antikam—to the proximity; vṛthā—uselessly; hataḥ—killed; śatadhanuḥ—Śatadhanvā; maṇiḥ—the jewel; tatra—with him; na vidyate—is not present.
translation: Not finding the jewel, Lord Kṛṣṇa went to His elder brother and said, "We have killed Śatadhanvā uselessly. The jewel isn't here."
